original: phying pa ni rab tu grags pa'o //üîΩla ba mthug po ni klam mo //
analyzed: phying pa ni rab tu grags pa'o // la ba mthug po ni klam mo //
translated: The felt is the well-known.üîΩThe thick cloth is the blanket.

original: ras seng ba ni gos phra mo ste /
analyzed: ras seng ba ni gos phra mo ste /
translated: The thin cloth is the thin cloth.

original: de dag ni dra bar bya ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag ni dra bar bya ba ma yin la /
translated: Those are not to be made into nets.

original: dgos pa yod pa ni byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa yod pa ni byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: The purpose is to bless.

original: rgas pa ni rgas pas gnas skabs gzhan thob pa'o //
analyzed: rgas pa ni rgas pas gnas skabs gzhan thob pa'o //
translated: Old age is the attainment of another stage through old age.

original: glags bltas pa ni zil gyis mnan par bya bar ro //üîΩrkun po ni mthus 'phrog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: glags bltas pa ni zil gyis mnan par bya bar ro // rkun po ni mthus 'phrog par byed pa'o //
translated: The one who is watching for an opportunity is one who is to be overpowered.üîΩThe thief is one who steals by force.

original: g-yon can ni 'jab bus rku bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yon can ni 'jab bus rku bar byed pa'o //
translated: The swindler is one who steals by stealth.

original: snga ma ni rang gis sems kyis phyung la zhes bya ba ni chos gos de la ltos pa med par bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni rang gis sems kyis phyung la zhes bya ba ni chos gos de la ltos pa med par bya ba'o //
translated: The former, having taken it out with his own mind, means that he has made it independent of that robe.üîΩThe latter, having taken it out with his own mind, means that he has made it independent of that robe.

original: ngas sngar bshad pa zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong gi gzhi las dge sbyong gis gso sbyong gi nyi ma la gnas mal bshams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad bsgrubs nas gal te gso sbyong byin gyis brlab tu rung ba'i dge slong rnyed par ma
analyzed: ngas sngar bshad pa zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong gi gzhi las dge sbyong gis gso sbyong gi nyi ma la gnas mal bshams te zhes bya ba la sogs pa thams cad bsgrubs nas gal te gso sbyong byin gyis brlab tu rung ba'i dge slong rnyed par ma
translated: I have explained before means that in the Prati-moksa it is said that on the Po·π£adha day, the monk should prepare the bedding and so forth, and having accomplished all of that, if he does not find a monk who is suitable to consecrate the Po·π£adha,

original: gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: at that time,

original: sems kyis gso sbyong byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyis gso sbyong byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: he should consecrate the Po·π£adha with his mind.

original: de bzhin du dgag dbye bya ba dang / gcig pus gos byin @26a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du dgag dbye bya ba dang / gcig pus gos byin @26a * //
translated: Likewise, the lifting of restrictions should be done, and the robe should be given by one alone.

original: gyis brlab pa dang / med pa'i dus su chos gos dbyung ba dang / gang zag gis mgron du bos pa la gnyis pa yod na sems kyis dang du blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gyis brlab pa dang / med pa'i dus su chos gos dbyung ba dang / gang zag gis mgron du bos pa la gnyis pa yod na sems kyis dang du blang bar bya'o //
translated: and the consecration of the Buddha's body, and the wearing of the religious robe at the time of the absence of the Buddha, and the acceptance of the invitation of a person, if there is a second, by the mind.

original: gdungs pa ni gzir bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gdungs pa ni gzir bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Afflicted means oppressed.

original: bskal pa ste bskal pa chen po'i bya ba yin la de dag gi stong de la'o //
analyzed: bskal pa ste bskal pa chen po'i bya ba yin la de dag gi stong de la'o //
translated: The aeon is the great aeon, and it is the thousandth part of that.

original: dka' bas rnyed par nus pa'i phyir rnyed dka' ba'o //
analyzed: dka' bas rnyed par nus pa'i phyir rnyed dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to obtain because it is possible through difficulty.

original: 'dren pa ni mdun du gshegs par mdzad pa zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'dren pa de la'o //üîΩsnying rje'i bdag nyid can snying rjes dbang du byas pa'i thugs gang gis g-yo med pa'i dgongs pas sems can la thugs rje ba ste ;
analyzed: 'dren pa ni mdun du gshegs par mdzad pa zhes bya ba de'i phyir 'dren pa de la'o // snying rje'i bdag nyid can snying rjes dbang du byas pa'i thugs gang gis g-yo med pa'i dgongs pas sems can la thugs rje ba ste ;
translated: The leader is the one who goes in front, and therefore it is for that leader.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral bar bzhed pa'o //üîΩsrid par chags pa zhes bya ba la srid par chags pa ni sred pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral bar bzhed pa'o // srid par chags pa zhes bya ba la srid par chags pa ni sred pa ste /
translated: The mind of the compassionate one, the one who is governed by compassion, is the one that is compassionate to sentient beings with an unwavering intention, and it is the one that wishes to free them from suffering.üîΩThe attachment to existence is craving, and it is the abandonment of that.

original: de rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: The attachment to the world is the attachment to the world, and it is the abandonment of that.

original: 'dis ni sred pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni sred pa bag chags dang bcas par spangs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that craving is abandoned together with its residual impressions.

original: de'i bstan pa mchog la srog gcod pa las slar bzlog pa la sogs pa bslab pa bzung zhing blangs nas srog 'tsho ba ni yongs su gtang par bya'i /
analyzed: de'i bstan pa mchog la srog gcod pa las slar bzlog pa la sogs pa bslab pa bzung zhing blangs nas srog 'tsho ba ni yongs su gtang par bya'i /
translated: Having taken up the training in turning away from taking life, etc., in his supreme teaching, he should give up his life,

original: 'on kyang srog gcad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang srog gcad par mi bya'o //
translated: but he should not take life.

original: mthu ni 'dir lus kyi nus pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mthu ni 'dir lus kyi nus pa la bya'o //
translated: Here power refers to the capacity of the body.

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi dag gi yin pa de dag ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris te /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi dag gi yin pa de dag ni rgyal chen bzhi'i ris te /
translated: The Caturmaharajakas are those who belong to the group of the four great kings.

original: de dag tu skye ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dag tu skye ba ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Birth in their realm is rebirth there.

original: chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By nature means that it is inevitable.

original: yongs su gnas pa ni yongs su gnas pa'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: yongs su gnas pa ni yongs su gnas pa'i gnas skabs te /
translated: The state of abiding is the state of abiding in that.

original: des gang gi tshe mtho ris de na spyod lam bzhi po gang yang rung ba gcig gis yongs su gnas pa de'i tshe yongs su gnas pa sten par 'gyur ba de skabs sgrub par mi byed pa'i blo can gyi lha'i bu skyes nas yun ring du ma lon
analyzed: des gang gi tshe mtho ris de na spyod lam bzhi po gang yang rung ba gcig gis yongs su gnas pa de'i tshe yongs su gnas pa sten par 'gyur ba de skabs sgrub par mi byed pa'i blo can gyi lha'i bu skyes nas yun ring du ma lon
translated: When he is abiding in any one of the four postures in that heaven, then he is abiding.

original: pa bcom ldan 'das la blta pa'i phyir nye bar 'gro bar byed do //üîΩlus rab tu g-yo bar byed pa'i phyir rna cha gdub kor g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: pa bcom ldan 'das la blta pa'i phyir nye bar 'gro bar byed do // lus rab tu g-yo bar byed pa'i phyir rna cha gdub kor g-yo ba'o //
translated: The newly born god, who is not yet accustomed to the pleasures of heaven, goes to see the Lord with a mind that does not seek to enjoy them.üîΩHis earrings swing because his body moves.

original: dri ma med pa ni shin tu 'tsher ba'o //üîΩlto ba'i phyogs khyab pa ni do shal lo //üîΩnu ma'i phyogs khyab pa ni se mo do'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni shin tu 'tsher ba'o // lto ba'i phyogs khyab pa ni do shal lo // nu ma'i phyogs khyab pa ni se mo do'o //
translated: His ornaments are spotless because they are very bright.üîΩHis necklace covers his chest.üîΩHis bracelets cover his upper arms.

original: brgyan ni spud pa'o //
analyzed: brgyan ni spud pa'o //
translated: His anklets cover his ankles.üîΩHis ornaments are his adornments.

original: lha'i 'byor ba yin pa'i phyir lha'i 'o //
analyzed: lha'i 'byor ba yin pa'i phyir lha'i 'o //
translated: They are divine because they are the wealth of the gods.

original: snang ba ni 'od kyis so //
analyzed: snang ba ni 'od kyis so //
translated: They shine with light.

original: bsam pa ni rgya che ba dang / rgya che ba ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa la mos pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni rgya che ba dang / rgya che ba ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa la mos pa dang mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: His intention is his vast aspiration to teach the Dharma, whether vast or not.

original: bag la nyal ba ni nyon mongs pa drag cing drag pa'i kun du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: bag la nyal ba ni nyon mongs pa drag cing drag pa'i kun du spyod pa ste /
translated: Latent tendency means the strong and intense practice of the afflictions.

original: @26b gang la nyon mongs pa gang gis gnod par gyur pa de la de dang rjes su mthun par ston pa'o //
analyzed: @26b gang la nyon mongs pa gang gis gnod par gyur pa de la de dang rjes su mthun par ston pa'o //
translated: For whomsoever and by whichsoever affliction one is harmed, for him and by that one should teach in accordance.

original: khams ni rigs yin te /
analyzed: khams ni rigs yin te /
translated: Constituent means family.

original: 'ga' zhig ni 'jam po dang / 'ga' zhig ni rtsub pa'i chos bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ni 'jam po dang / 'ga' zhig ni rtsub pa'i chos bstan pas 'dul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some are disciplined by the teaching of the Dharma that is gentle, and some by the teaching of the Dharma that is harsh.

original: dmyal pa'i gtam ni rtsub pa yin la /
analyzed: dmyal pa'i gtam ni rtsub pa yin la /
translated: The teaching of the hells is harsh.

original: mtho ris kyi gtam ni bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi gtam ni bzlog pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the higher realms is the opposite.

original: rang bzhin ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Nature means the nature of the faculties such as faith.

original: dbang po rno rtul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rno rtul tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the difference in sharpness and dullness of the faculties.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi so sor rtogs par byed pa de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud pa dang rjes su mthun par ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi so sor rtogs par byed pa de ltar zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi khong du chud pa dang rjes su mthun par ro //
translated: In accordance with that means in accordance with the understanding of the four noble truths.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The view of the transitory collection, etc.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu dag gis mtho bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i ri'i rtse mo nyi shu dag gis mtho bar gyur pa ste /
translated: The twenty peaks of the mountain chain of the view of the transitory collection are high.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rtse mo lnga la bdag ma gtogs pa phung po lngar yongs su brtags te /üîΩde la rgyan dang 'dra bar 'dzin la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po lnga la bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / 'jig tshogs su lta ba'i rtse mo lnga la bdag ma gtogs pa phung po lngar yongs su brtags te / de la rgyan dang 'dra bar 'dzin la /
translated: The five peaks of the view of the transitory collection are high because they are the five views that apprehend the five aggregates of form and so on as the self.üîΩThe first five views are like ornaments.

original: cig shos lnga la bran dang 'dra bar 'dzin cing gzhan lnga la snod dang 'dra bar lta bar byed do //
analyzed: cig shos lnga la bran dang 'dra bar 'dzin cing gzhan lnga la snod dang 'dra bar lta bar byed do //
translated: The other five views are like servants and the remaining five views are like containers.

original: yang lnga ni ji skad du gzugs la bdag dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs bdag gi yin pa dang / gzugs la bdag gnas so zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs bdag 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yang lnga ni ji skad du gzugs la bdag dang / bdag gzugs dang ldan pa dang / gzugs bdag gi yin pa dang / gzugs la bdag gnas so zhes yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs bdag 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The five views that arise are the views that correctly see form as the self, the self as possessing form, form as belonging to the self, the self as dwelling in form and form as being in the self.

original: 'jig tshogs su lta ba yang nyon mongs pa thams cad skye ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag gang gi gtso bo yin pa ste de bas na nyon mongs pa'i gtso bo bcom par bstan pa las mthong bas spang bar
analyzed: 'jig tshogs su lta ba yang nyon mongs pa thams cad skye ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo nyid yin pa'i phyir mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag gang gi gtso bo yin pa ste de bas na nyon mongs pa'i gtso bo bcom par bstan pa las mthong bas spang bar
translated: The view of the perishing aggregates is the principal cause of the arising of all afflictions, and thus it is the principal object to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom zhing spangs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom zhing spangs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is taught that the principal afflictions are destroyed, it is taught that all afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing are destroyed.

original: khyod mthus te khyod kyis phan 'dogs par mdzad pa'i nus pas bkag par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: khyod mthus te khyod kyis phan 'dogs par mdzad pa'i nus pas bkag par gyur pa'o //
translated: By your power, by the power of your benefit and assistance, they are blocked.

original: rab drag ces bya ba ni shin tu drag par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rab drag ces bya ba ni shin tu drag par gyur pa'o //
translated: Very strong means they are extremely strong.

original: ngan song shul zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa ni ngan song gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ngan song shul dang / srid pa bar ma do'i ngan song de gnyi ga bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: ngan song shul zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa ni ngan song gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ngan song shul dang / srid pa bar ma do'i ngan song de gnyi ga bkag pa yin te /
translated: The path to the lower realms is the path to the lower realms because karma and affliction that lead to the lower realms are the cause of the lower realms, and both the lower realms and the intermediate state of the lower realms are blocked.

original: ngan song ba'i las dang rjes su mthun pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun du spyod pa med pa'i phyir dang / ngan song ba'i snga na med pa'i las ma byas pa'i @27a * //
analyzed: ngan song ba'i las dang rjes su mthun pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun du spyod pa med pa'i phyir dang / ngan song ba'i snga na med pa'i las ma byas pa'i @27a * //
translated: because they do not create the karma of the lower realms that has not previously existed,

original: phyir dang / byas pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i phyogs zad par gyur pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa bkag pa yin la /
analyzed: phyir dang / byas pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i phyogs zad par gyur pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa bkag pa yin la /
translated: and because they have exhausted the karma that would be the concomitant of the karma that has been created, they have stopped karma and afflictions.

original: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir ngan song ba'i phung po'i srid pa bar ma do'i lam bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir ngan song ba'i phung po'i srid pa bar ma do'i lam bkag pa yin no //
translated: Because they have attained the cessation that is not due to deliberation, they have stopped the existence of the aggregates of the lower realms in the intermediate state.

original: mtho ris 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mtho ris su skyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni mtho ris su skyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúGoing to the higher realms‚Äù means being born in the higher realms.

original: bsod nams bzang po byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gang dag la yod pa de ni bsod nams bzang po byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams bzang po byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gang dag la yod pa de ni bsod nams bzang po byed pa'o //
translated: Those who have the cause of creating good merit are ‚Äúthose who create good merit.‚Äù

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i shul ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i shul ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúpath to nirvana‚Äù is the eightfold noble path.

original: shin tu rnam dag khyod bstan bdag gis ni //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag khyod bstan bdag gis ni //
translated: You, who are so pure, have taught

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la khyod kyi bka' drin las bdag gis de ring dag pa'i mig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la khyod kyi bka' drin las bdag gis de ring dag pa'i mig ste /
translated: In this and other verses, he says: Today, through your kindness, I have obtained the pure eye,

original: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi mtshan nyid thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi mtshan nyid thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: which is the characteristic of uncontaminated wisdom.

original: dag pa'i rgyu mtshan ni skyon bral zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dag pa'i rgyu mtshan ni skyon bral zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The pure reason is stated in the line free from the fault of defilement,

original: rang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi phyir nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa dang bral bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the fault of the afflictions.

original: shin tu rnam dag ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la 'bod pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das la 'bod pa'o //
translated: The line O you who are completely pure is an address to the Blessed One.

original: go 'phang zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: go 'phang zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The state of peace is nirvana,

original: nyon mongs pa'i rgod pa zhi ba'i phyir dang / 'dus byas mi rtag pa'i rgod pa zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rgod pa zhi ba'i phyir dang / 'dus byas mi rtag pa'i rgod pa zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the agitation of the afflictions is pacified and the agitation of conditioned phenomena is pacified.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa ni bzhed cing bsten par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa ni bzhed cing bsten par bya ba yin te /
translated: The line pleasing to the noble ones means that it is to be accepted and relied upon.

original: yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs pa ni 'phags pa dgyes pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: yid la re ba yongs su rdzogs pa ni 'phags pa dgyes pa thob pa'o //

translated: Because he discerns in general what should and should not be done, he is called wise.üîΩRoots are ginger and so on.üîΩStems are leeks and so on.

original: lo ma ni bal bu'i lo ma la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma ni bal bu'i lo ma la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: me tog ni klu shing gi me tog la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: 'bras bu ni sman aa ru ra la sogs pa'o//

analyzed: gang gi rkang mthil la grong khyer dang rtsig pa'i rnam pa lta bu'i ri mo yod pa'o //

original: rta babs ni rtsa ba'i sgo las phyi rol gyi rtsig pa ma gtogs par shing gnyis bsgrengs pa la shing gcig gis steng nas bkab pa sgo'i rnam pa lta bu yin te /

analyzed: 'di'i ming gzhan ni sgo dang po zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: dogs pa med pas song shig ces bya ba ni bya ba med par gyur pas so //

original: rje bo ni bdag po'o //
analyzed: rje bo ni bdag po'o //

analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu thos te zhes bya ba ni mthar gyis gtam thos par gyur te'o //

original: dpung gi tshogs ni dpung gi 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: dpung gi tshogs ni dpung gi 'dus pa'o //

original: yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi ste /

analyzed: shing rta bsnur du rung ba'i lam po che ni tshong dus kyi srang ngo //

analyzed: dril bsgrags te zhes bya ba rgyal po'i bkas dam bcas pa dril dkrol zhing sgrogs par byed pa gang yin pa de ni dril bsgrags pa'o // grong na gnas pas na grong mi rnams so //
translated: A proclamation is a declaration made by the king's order.

original: dpal yang dag par @33a * //
analyzed: dpal yang dag par @33a * //
translated: The people of the town are the inhabitants of the town.üîΩThe glorious

analyzed: skyes nas zhes bya ba ni dpal che ba nyid dam snga na med pa'i dpal byung nas so //

translated: Having made her his wife, he brings her to his own house, which is to say, he takes her as his wife.üîΩSince he is the lord of the one who is to be despised, he is the husband, the husband of the slave.

original: bu za bar byed pas na bu zan mo ste srin mo'o //
analyzed: bu za bar byed pas na bu zan mo ste srin mo'o //
translated: Since she eats her own children, she is a cannibal, a rƒÅk·π£asƒ´.

analyzed: kha cig ni de'i bu mo mkha' 'gro man la bu zan mo zhes zer ro //

original: de blta bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni de blta ba'i 'dod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de blta bar bgyi zhes bya ba ni de blta ba'i 'dod pa dang bcas pa'o //

analyzed: phan tshun mthong bar mos pa ni phrad pa'i brtson pa dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: dga' ba ni sred par gyur pa'o //
translated: Delight means having craving.

analyzed: dub par gyur pa las ngal ba gang yin pa des bskyed pa'i le lo ni kun nas bskyed pa'i le lo'o //

analyzed: nyes dmigs zhes bya ba ni nyes par gyur pa'o //

analyzed: khro ba zhes bya ba ni 'khrugs pa'i ngang tshul can te rtsva'i me dang 'dra bas skad cig gis 'bar bar byed pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mdud par 'dzin pa'o //

analyzed: snying rings pa zhes bya ba ni yid brtan pa 'joms par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: phan btags pa brjed pa'i phyir byas pa mi gzo ba'o //

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bskyed pa'o //

analyzed: slob pa'i slob dpon ni slob dpon dang mkhan po la bya ste /

analyzed: de gnyis med par rang gi blo dang nus pas zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: In the absence of those two, by one's own understanding and ability, up to the end.

analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya ba la /

original: 'di lta ste dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang ; dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa zhes bya'o //

translated: They are the four applications of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the noble eightfold path.

original: de mngon du byas pa ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de mngon du byas pa ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: One realizes them is one generates them.

original: mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba ni ye shes dang thob pa mngon sum du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba ni ye shes dang thob pa mngon sum du byas pa'o //
translated: One has realized them in person means one has realized them with knowledge and attainment.

original: 'bar ba ni lus @33b las me sbar ba'o //
analyzed: 'bar ba ni lus @33b las me sbar ba'o //
translated: Blazing means fire blazing from the body.

original: gsal ba ni 'od 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: gsal ba ni 'od 'phro ba'o //
translated: Shining means radiating light.

original: char 'bab pa ni chu 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: char 'bab pa ni chu 'bab pa'o //
translated: Raining means rain falling.

original: glog 'gyu ba ni glog 'phro ba ste /
analyzed: glog 'gyu ba ni glog 'phro ba ste /
translated: Lightning means lightning flashing.

original: re res kyang so so'i skye bo'i sems 'phrog par byed cing 'dren par byed pa'i phyir cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: re res kyang so so'i skye bo'i sems 'phrog par byed cing 'dren par byed pa'i phyir cho 'phrul lo //
translated: They are miracles because each of them attracts and leads the minds of ordinary beings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa dag ni 'phags pa dag las tha dad par gyur pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo dag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i 'ching bas bcings pa dag ni 'phags pa dag las tha dad par gyur pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo dag go //
translated: Ordinary beings are those who are bound by the fetters of the afflictions and are different from the noble ones.

original: bsod snyoms ni lus gnas pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms ni lus gnas pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Almsgiving is the means of support for the body.

original: rje'i sras zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rje'i sras zhes bya ba la /
translated: The son of a householder is called a householder‚Äôs son.

original: khyim bdag gi pha la 'dir rje bo yin par rig par bya ba yin la de'i bu ni rje'i sras so //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi pha la 'dir rje bo yin par rig par bya ba yin la de'i bu ni rje'i sras so //
translated: Here, the householder‚Äôs father is to be understood as the master, and his son is the householder‚Äôs son.

original: ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dag ni bdag nyid chen po'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dag ni bdag nyid chen po'o //
translated: Greatness of soul is the perfection of knowledge and abandonment.

original: brtul zhugs kyi 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir brtul zhugs grub pa'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs kyi 'bras bu thob pa'i phyir brtul zhugs grub pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment of austerity is the attainment of the fruit of austerity.

original: gso ba ni bskyed pa'o //üîΩgzugs bzang ba ni kha dog gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: gso ba ni bskyed pa'o // gzugs bzang ba ni kha dog gi sgo nas so //
translated: Nourishment is growth.üîΩGood appearance is from the point of view of color.

original: blta na sdug pa ni dbyibs kyi sgo nas so //üîΩmdzes pa ni sems dang ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: blta na sdug pa ni dbyibs kyi sgo nas so //üîΩmdzes pa ni sems dang ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Beautiful is from the point of view of shape.üîΩHandsome is from the point of view of generating faith.

original: gzhi brtag pa ni zhing dang khyim dang sa gzhi brtags pa dag yin te /
analyzed: gzhi brtag pa ni zhing dang khyim dang sa gzhi brtags pa dag yin te /
translated: The examination of the basis is the examination of the field, the house, and the ground.

original: sa gzhi bkra shis par spro bar bya ba dang / bkra shis ba ma yin par spro bar bya ba de bas na brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa gzhi bkra shis par spro bar bya ba dang / bkra shis ba ma yin par spro bar bya ba de bas na brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: The ground is auspicious or inauspicious, and so it is to be examined.

original: gos dag yon tan dang ldan pa dang / yon tan med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gos dag yon tan dang ldan pa dang / yon tan med par 'gyur ba de'i phyir brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: The cloth is endowed with good qualities or not, and so it is to be examined.

original: shing yang bya ba du ma la mkho ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shing yang bya ba du ma la mkho ba'i phyir /
translated: The tree is useful for many activities,

original: nang du ma zhi bar byed pa dang / gser la sogs pa'i rigs yod pas na brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nang du ma zhi bar byed pa dang / gser la sogs pa'i rigs yod pas na brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: and so it is to be examined.

original: glang po dang / rta dang / rin po che dang / skyes pa dang / bud med brtag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: glang po dang / rta dang / rin po che dang / skyes pa dang / bud med brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: The elephant, horse, jewel, man, and woman are to be examined.

original: dgos pa ni rab tu grags pa yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa ni rab tu grags pa yin no //
translated: The purpose is well known.

original: 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid mthong nas bstan bcos kyi sgor sbyor ba nyid du nus pa'i phyir 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid mthong nas bstan bcos kyi sgor sbyor ba nyid du nus pa'i phyir 'byed pa'o //
translated: The analysis is the analysis because it is able to apply to the door of the treatise after seeing the characteristics.

original: gzhan dag kyang ma lus pa khong du chud pas na klog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ma lus pa khong du chud pas na klog pa'o //
translated: And he is a reader because he has completely mastered all the others.

original: brtag pa de dag nyid mngon bar shes pas na mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: brtag pa de dag nyid mngon bar shes pas na mkhas pa'o //
translated: And he is a scholar because he has direct knowledge of those very investigations.

original: las su bya ba thams cad la sgrin pas na spyod pa gsal ba'o //
analyzed: las su bya ba thams cad la sgrin pas na spyod pa gsal ba'o //
translated: And he is a clear-minded practitioner because he is clever in all the tasks to be done.

analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi rgyud la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni bzo la sogs pa shes pa'i yul thams cad la mkhas pa'o //
translated: Skill in all the tantras means skill in all the objects of knowledge, such as the arts.

original: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs spyi bor dbang bskur zhing rgyal phran rnams kyis spyi bos phyag byas par gyur pa ste /üîΩ'dis @34a * //
analyzed: rgyal po zhes bya ba ni rgyal rigs spyi bor dbang bskur zhing rgyal phran rnams kyis spyi bos phyag byas par gyur pa ste / 'dis @34a * //
translated: A king is a member of the warrior class who has been consecrated on the head and is bowed to with the head by the minor kings.

original: ni go rims bzhin du thob pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ni go rims bzhin du thob pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: By this he shows the very attainment in order, saying he is a king.

original: ljongs kyi dbang phyug ni gtso bo nyid yin la de'i mthu ni nus pa'o //
analyzed: ljongs kyi dbang phyug ni gtso bo nyid yin la de'i mthu ni nus pa'o //
translated: The lord of the country is the chief, and his power is his ability.

original: brtson 'grus ni spro ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni spro ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Diligence is the perfection of enthusiasm.

original: yan lag thams cad las kyang ljongs kyi yan lag shes rab kyi nus pa dang / spro bas srung ba dang / spel ba dang / bskyang ba ni gtso bo'i nus pa yin te /
analyzed: yan lag thams cad las kyang ljongs kyi yan lag shes rab kyi nus pa dang / spro bas srung ba dang / spel ba dang / bskyang ba ni gtso bo'i nus pa yin te /
translated: The power of the lord is the power of wisdom and the power of enthusiasm to protect, increase, and maintain the power of the land.

original: gang gi phyir ljongs kyi rang bzhin yang dag par bskyangs par gyur pa na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ljongs kyi rang bzhin yang dag par bskyangs par gyur pa na /
translated: Because when the nature of the land is properly maintained,

original: bdag po blon po dang / chad pa dang / bang mdzod dang / mkhar dang / grogs bshes kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba de'i phyir ljongs kyi rang bzhin gyi dbang phyug kho na shes rab kyi bdag nyid dang nus pa dang / brtson pas lhag par spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag po blon po dang / chad pa dang / bang mdzod dang / mkhar dang / grogs bshes kyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba de'i phyir ljongs kyi rang bzhin gyi dbang phyug kho na shes rab kyi bdag nyid dang nus pa dang / brtson pas lhag par spyod par bya'o //
translated: the nature of the lord, the ministers, the punishments, the treasury, the fortresses, and the friends and allies will be good. Therefore, the lord of the land should especially practice wisdom, power, and enthusiasm.

original: sa chen po'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni glog pa dang ljongs kyi dbang phyug la gnas pa'i gtso bo nyid dang mkhas pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sa chen po'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni glog pa dang ljongs kyi dbang phyug la gnas pa'i gtso bo nyid dang mkhas pa nyid du bstan pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe great sphere of the earth‚Äù indicates the supremacy and skillfulness of the lord who resides in the land and the country.

original: don de nyid 'dir yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don de nyid 'dir yang shes par bya ste /
translated: This meaning should be understood here as well.

original: de ni 'di skad du ljongs kyi dbang phyug mi'i bdag po dang / rgyal phran la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi sa chen po'i dkyil 'khor nyid gtso bo kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ljongs kyi dbang phyug mi'i bdag po dang / rgyal phran la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag gi sa chen po'i dkyil 'khor nyid gtso bo kho na yin te /
translated: The meaning of the verse is this: The great circle of the earth is the chief of those who are lords of the land, kings of men, and rulers of the provinces, etc.

original: rgyal po'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyal po'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the king of kings.

original: mngon par rgyal bar byas pa ni rgyal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rgyal bar byas pa ni rgyal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the conqueror, because it conquers.

original: gnas pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni dbang byed pa dang / srung bar byed pa dag gi zhes bya bar dgongs so //üîΩbzo'i gnas zhes bya ba ni slob pa po khong du chud pa'i gzhi ni bzo'i gnas so //üîΩlas kyi gnas ni slob pa dang rtsom pa sgrub pa dag yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni dbang byed pa dang / srung bar byed pa dag gi zhes bya bar dgongs so // bzo'i gnas zhes bya ba ni slob pa po khong du chud pa'i gzhi ni bzo'i gnas so // las kyi gnas ni slob pa dang rtsom pa sgrub pa dag yin te /
translated: It is the support of those who are supported, i.e., of those who rule and those who are protected.üîΩThe arts are the bases of learning.üîΩThe crafts are the bases of work.üîΩThe arts are to be accomplished by training, and the crafts are to be accomplished by undertaking.

original: gnad la sogs pa la phog pa ni bslab pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gnad la sogs pa la phog pa ni bslab pa'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba yin la /
translated: The arts are the bases of learning, and the crafts are the bases of work.

original: glang po che la sogs pa la zhon pa'i bslab pa dang / brtsal ba'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni tshul sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: glang po che la sogs pa la zhon pa'i bslab pa dang / brtsal ba'i sgo nas bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni tshul sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: The various ways are the different ways of training in riding elephants, horses, and chariots, and the way of accomplishing something by searching for it.

original: glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta la zhon pa zhes bya ba ni gnas gcig yin no//
analyzed: glang po che dang / rta dang / shing rta la zhon pa zhes bya ba ni gnas gcig yin no//
translated: Riding elephants, horses, and chariots is one topic.

original: ral gri'i thabs ni ral gri la sogs pa'i 'dzin stangs te /
analyzed: ral gri'i thabs ni ral gri la sogs pa'i 'dzin stangs te /
translated: The art of the sword is the way of holding a sword, etc.

original: de la mkhas pa nyid ni 'dzin stangs shes pa'o //
analyzed: de la mkhas pa nyid ni 'dzin stangs shes pa'o //
translated: Skill in that is the knowledge of how to hold it.

original: gzhu la mkhas pa nyid ni gzhu'i rig pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhu la mkhas pa nyid ni gzhu'i rig pa shes pa ste /
translated: Skill in archery is the knowledge of archery.

original: 'dis ni mda' dang mtshon cha shes pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni mda' dang mtshon cha shes pa ste /
translated: This is the knowledge of arrows and weapons.

original: gnas gnyis pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas gnyis pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the second topic.

original: phyir bsnur ba ni g-yul las @34b phyir log pa'o //
analyzed: phyir bsnur ba ni g-yul las @34b phyir log pa'o //
translated: Retreating is turning back from battle.

original: mdun du bsnur ba ni rab tu 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: mdun du bsnur ba ni rab tu 'jug pa ste /
translated: Advancing is attacking.

original: 'di la mkhas pa nyid ni gnas gsum yin no //
analyzed: 'di la mkhas pa nyid ni gnas gsum yin no //
translated: Skill in these is the third topic.

original: lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang / mda' bo che 'dzin pa la mkhas pa nyid ni /
analyzed: lcags kyu dang zhags pa dang / mda' bo che 'dzin pa la mkhas pa nyid ni /
translated: Skill in the hook, the lasso, the great

original: mda' dang mtshon cha shes pa kho na'i nang du 'du'o //üîΩgcad pa ni go cha'i mdud pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mda' dang mtshon cha shes pa kho na'i nang du 'du'o // gcad pa ni go cha'i mdud pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: arrow, and the sword is included in the knowledge of arrows and weapons.üîΩCutting is the knot of armor, etc.

original: dral ba ni ya lad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dral ba ni ya lad la sogs pa'o //
translated: Ripping is the armor, etc.

original: dbug pa ni gnad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbug pa ni gnad la sogs pa'o //
translated: Piercing is the vital part, etc.

original: de dag la mkhas pa yang mda' dang mtshon cha shes pa'i nang du 'du'o //
analyzed: de dag la mkhas pa yang mda' dang mtshon cha shes pa'i nang du 'du'o //
translated: Skill in these is included in the knowledge of arrows and weapons.

original: gom stangs kyi g-yul shes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gom stangs kyi g-yul shes pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the knowledge of the battle of gait.

original: de nyid kyang 'dzin stangs dang / gom stangs dang / thor tshugs kyi 'dzin stangs la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyang 'dzin stangs dang / gom stangs dang / thor tshugs kyi 'dzin stangs la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: This is also skill in the grasp, the gait, and the grasp of the topknot.

original: pha rol po'i ral gri 'am shang lang gis rab tu bsnun par 'dod pa'i khu tshur ji ltar gzhan gyi brdeg spyad par 'gyur ba de ltar 'dzin pa yin la dbug pa'i g-yul la gom stangs nye bar mkho ba yin no //
analyzed: pha rol po'i ral gri 'am shang lang gis rab tu bsnun par 'dod pa'i khu tshur ji ltar gzhan gyi brdeg spyad par 'gyur ba de ltar 'dzin pa yin la dbug pa'i g-yul la gom stangs nye bar mkho ba yin no //
translated: One grasps the sword or the knife of the opponent in such a way that it becomes a weapon of the other. The battle of piercing is the need for the gait.

original: thor tshugs kyi 'dzin stangs ni skra'i 'dzin thabs yin te /
analyzed: thor tshugs kyi 'dzin stangs ni skra'i 'dzin thabs yin te /
translated: The mode of grasping a topknot is the method of holding the hair.

original: g-yul mang po kho na yod do //
analyzed: g-yul mang po kho na yod do //
translated: There are many kinds of battles.

original: sgra'i rjes su 'brangs nas rdeg par byed pa ni sgra grag par phog pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i rjes su 'brangs nas rdeg par byed pa ni sgra grag par phog pa'o //

original: gnad la rdeg par byed pa ni gnad du phog pa'o //
analyzed: gnad la rdeg par byed pa ni gnad du phog pa'o //
translated: Striking the vital point is striking the vital point.

original: 'khrul pa med par bsnun pa ni mi 'tshor bar phog pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med par bsnun pa ni mi 'tshor bar phog pa'o //

original: gting du bsnun pa ni tshabs che ba'o //
analyzed: gting du bsnun pa ni tshabs che ba'o //
translated: Striking deeply is striking with great force.

original: gcad pa la sogs pas mtshon cha ltung bar byed pa shes pa ni gnas lnga yin no /
analyzed: gcad pa la sogs pas mtshon cha ltung bar byed pa shes pa ni gnas lnga yin no /

original: gzhan dag ni gcad pa la sogs pa gnas gsum dag yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gcad pa la sogs pa gnas gsum dag yin la /
translated: Others say: Cutting and so on are the third abode.

original: 'dzin stangs la sogs pa gnas bzhi pa yin zhing /
analyzed: 'dzin stangs la sogs pa gnas bzhi pa yin zhing /
translated: The mode of grasping and so on are the fourth abode.

original: dgra la phog pa la sogs pa gnas lnga pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: dgra la phog pa la sogs pa gnas lnga pa yin par brjod do //
translated: Striking the enemy and so on are the fifth abode.

original: bram ze'i spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bram ze la rigs pa'i spyod lam dang cha lugs la bya'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bram ze la rigs pa'i spyod lam dang cha lugs la bya'o //
translated: The so-called conduct of brahmins refers to the proper conduct and attire of brahmins.

original: cho ga zhes bya ba ni bram ze la rigs pa'i spyod pa ngang tshul spyod nyid yin te /
analyzed: cho ga zhes bya ba ni bram ze la rigs pa'i spyod pa ngang tshul spyod nyid yin te /
translated: The term ritual refers to the conduct of a brahmin, which is the practice of his caste.

original: rtag pa dang / 'dod pa nyid dang / rgyu mtshan gyi las dag la nan tan du byed pa la bya bar man ngag brgyud pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / 'dod pa nyid dang / rgyu mtshan gyi las dag la nan tan du byed pa la bya bar man ngag brgyud pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: It is said that this is to be learned from the tradition of the scriptures, which are the means of knowing the rules of conduct, the reasons for the rites, and the reasons for the actions.

original: gtsang sbra zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs ngang tshul mthun pa'i yan lag gi gtsang sbra la bya'o //
analyzed: gtsang sbra zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs ngang tshul mthun pa'i yan lag gi gtsang sbra la bya'o //
translated: The term purity refers to the purity of the limbs that is appropriate to the occasion.

original: mtshungs par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bram ze la rigs pa sngon du ldang ba dang / gsod por smra ba la sogs pa phan tshun kun du tha snyad du byed pa kho na la bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bram ze la rigs pa sngon du ldang ba dang / gsod por smra ba la sogs pa phan tshun kun du tha snyad du byed pa kho na la bya'o //
translated: The term fellow practitioners refers to those who engage in mutual transactions, such as the brahmins who rise before others and the deceitful speakers.

original: @35a * // ril ba'i sgras ni bram ze dag gis gtsang sbra byed pa'i snod yin te /
analyzed: @35a * // ril ba'i sgras ni bram ze dag gis gtsang sbra byed pa'i snod yin te /
translated: The term water pot refers to the vessel used by the brahmins for their purificatory rites,

original: spyi blugs zhes kyang brjod pa gang yin pa de gnas skabs dang rjes su mthun par 'dzin pa bslab par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: spyi blugs zhes kyang brjod pa gang yin pa de gnas skabs dang rjes su mthun par 'dzin pa bslab par bya ba yin no //
translated: which is also called a spouted vessel. It should be held in accordance with the rules.

original: thal ba len pa zhes bya ba ni thal ba'i bya ba gang yin pa de'i don du len par byed pa ni bram ze la rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: thal ba len pa zhes bya ba ni thal ba'i bya ba gang yin pa de'i don du len par byed pa ni bram ze la rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: The so-called taking of ashes is the taking of ashes for the purpose of the act of ashes, and it is proper for the Brahmin to do it.

original: sas kyang gang gi phyir ji srid du ji ltar gtsang sbra'i don du len par byed pa yin pa de bas na bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sas kyang gang gi phyir ji srid du ji ltar gtsang sbra'i don du len par byed pa yin pa de bas na bstan pa yin no //
translated: And the earth, because it is taken for the purpose of purification, is the teacher.üîΩThat syllable Om is to be meditated upon by the Brahmin, and therefore it is to be grasped in accordance with that meditation.

original: yi ge aom de ni bram zes bsgom par bya ba de bas na de sgom pa dang rjes su mthun pas na gzung bar bya ba dang / yi ge bho zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyi dus su legs par sbyar bas 'bod pa yin pas na bram zes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yi ge aom de ni bram zes bsgom par bya ba de bas na de sgom pa dang rjes su mthun pas na gzung bar bya ba dang / yi ge bho zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor gyi dus su legs par sbyar bas 'bod pa yin pas na bram zes ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The syllable Bho is to be uttered by the Brahmin in the proper way, since it is uttered at the time of yoga.

original: des brjod kyi rig byed ni nges brjod shes pa'i ngag gi tshig gi tshad nges pa dag go //
analyzed: des brjod kyi rig byed ni nges brjod shes pa'i ngag gi tshig gi tshad nges pa dag go //
translated: The Nigada is the fixed number of words of knowledge for the knower of the Nigada.

original: mchod sbyin gyi rig byed ni tshig gi tshad ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi rig byed ni tshig gi tshad ma nges pa'o //
translated: The Yajus is the fixed number of words for the knower of the Yajus.üîΩThe Saman is the fixed number of words for the knower of the Saman.üîΩThe Atharvan is the fixed number of words for the knower of the Atharvan.

original: snyan tshig gi rig byed ni brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i bstod pa'i dag go //
analyzed: snyan tshig gi rig byed ni brgya byin dang tshangs pa la sogs pa'i bstod pa'i dag go //
translated: The hymns of praise are the hymns of praise to Indra, Brahma, etc.

original: srid srung gi rig byed ni skye dgu bsrung ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i ched du bstan pa ste /
analyzed: srid srung gi rig byed ni skye dgu bsrung ba'i thabs su gyur pa'i ched du bstan pa ste /
translated: The hymns of protection are the hymns of protection for the protection of living beings.

original: bram ze'i rig byed bzhi'i sgra'i don yongs su shes par bya ba yin pa dang / las dang shes pa la nges par sbyar bar bya ba yin par shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bram ze'i rig byed bzhi'i sgra'i don yongs su shes par bya ba yin pa dang / las dang shes pa la nges par sbyar bar bya ba yin par shes par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It should be understood that the meaning of the words of the four Vedas of the Brahmins is to be understood, and that they are to be applied to action and knowledge.

original: drang srong gar ga dang / ma tha ra'i gzhung zhes bya ba ni skar ma'i bstan bcos yin la /
analyzed: drang srong gar ga dang / ma tha ra'i gzhung zhes bya ba ni skar ma'i bstan bcos yin la /
translated: The texts of the sages Garga and Mathara are called the treatises on astrology.

original: sa g-yo ba dang 'bras bu'i rnam par bshad pa ni skar ma'i gzhung nyid yin te /
analyzed: sa g-yo ba dang 'bras bu'i rnam par bshad pa ni skar ma'i gzhung nyid yin te /
translated: The explanation of earthquakes and fruits is the treatise on astrology itself.

original: de dag la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la mkhas pa'o //
translated: They are experts in that.

original: nang zhes bya ba ni bram ze dag gis bsgrag par bya ba ma yin pa'i gzhung yin /
analyzed: nang zhes bya ba ni bram ze dag gis bsgrag par bya ba ma yin pa'i gzhung yin /

original: nges brjod kyang gzhung de dag nyid kyi bye brag yin te /
analyzed: nges brjod kyang gzhung de dag nyid kyi bye brag yin te /
translated: The Nirukta is also a particular text of those.

original: de la yang mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang mkhas pa'o //
translated: They are experts in that.

original: mchod sbyin byed pa ni bdag nyid mchod sbyin byed pa'o //
analyzed: mchod sbyin byed pa ni bdag nyid mchod sbyin byed pa'o //
translated: The performance of sacrifices is the performance of sacrifices by oneself.

analyzed: mchod sbyin byed du 'jug pa ni nges brjod mkhan du gyur pa'i sgo nas gzhan byed du 'jug pa'o//
translated: The causing of others to perform sacrifices is the causing of others to perform sacrifices by becoming a priest.

original: 'don pa ni bdag nyid klog pa'o //
analyzed: 'don pa ni bdag nyid klog pa'o //
translated: Reciting is reciting by oneself.

original: 'don du bcug pa ni gzhan 'don du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: 'don du bcug pa ni gzhan 'don du bcug pa'o //
translated: Causing to recite is causing others to recite.

original: sbyin pa ni bram ze rnams la'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni bram ze rnams la'o //
translated: Giving is giving to Brahmins.

original: len pa ni bram zes rigs gsum po dag la ste /
analyzed: len pa ni bram zes rigs gsum po dag la ste /
translated: Taking is taking from the three classes by Brahmins.

original: drug po de dag ni bram ze'i las yin no //
analyzed: drug po de dag ni bram ze'i las yin no //
translated: These six are the actions of Brahmins.

original: brtson pa ni mngon bar sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: brtson pa ni mngon bar sbyor ba'o //
translated: Striving is exertion.üîΩAnger is the arising of anger.

original: khro ba cher skyes nas @35b zhes bya ba la brnag mi bzod pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dir khro ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khro ba cher skyes nas @35b zhes bya ba la brnag mi bzod pa'i rang bzhin ni 'dir khro ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The nature of intolerance is to be understood here as anger.

original: skyes bu gla ba zhes bya ba la glas pas byed pa gang yin pa de ni gla ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gla ba zhes bya ba la glas pas byed pa gang yin pa de ni gla ba'o //
translated: The man who is hired is the hired man.

original: nam nga'i yab lhag nyid du bzhud par gyur pa na zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa spangs nas mtho ris thob par gyur pa na'o //
analyzed: nam nga'i yab lhag nyid du bzhud par gyur pa na zhes bya ba ni ris mthun pa spangs nas mtho ris thob par gyur pa na'o //

original: pha rol gnod pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni gsod par byed pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: pha rol gnod pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba ni gsod par byed pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the application of harm from others‚Äù means by the application of killing.

original: dgon pa'i nags kyi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dgon pa'i nags kyi gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: grong las rgyang grags kyi mtha' phan chad ni dgon pa yin la /
translated: The wilderness is beyond the range of a kro≈õa from a village.

original: nags kyi gnas ni nags kyi phyogs gcig yin no //
analyzed: nags kyi gnas ni nags kyi phyogs gcig yin no //
translated: A forest dwelling is a part of a forest.

original: khyad par du mthar gyur pa ni bas mtha'o //üîΩrnal 'byor ba 'di la nyal ba'i phyir mal yin la /
analyzed: khyad par du mthar gyur pa ni bas mtha'o // rnal 'byor ba 'di la nyal ba'i phyir mal yin la /
translated: The extreme limit is the edge of a forest.

analyzed: 'di la 'dug pa'i phyir stan yin no // gtsang ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par dben pa'am /

original: dag par ram dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dag par ram dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPure‚Äù means secluded, or it means pure or delightful.

original: sdig pa'i skye bo ste rgal dka' ba'am /
analyzed: sdig pa'i skye bo ste rgal dka' ba'am /
translated: ‚ÄúEvil people‚Äù are difficult to cross over, or they are contemptible.

original: smad pa'i las ni sdig pa'i skye bo yin la /
analyzed: smad pa'i las ni sdig pa'i skye bo yin la /
translated: Evil people are the action of contempt.

original: bral ba ni med par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bral ba ni med par gyur pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFree from‚Äù means without.

analyzed: sdig pa'i skye bo gang la yod pa ma yin pa de ni sdig pa'i skye bo dang bral ba'o //

analyzed: sems can rgyu ba med pa ni dben pa yin la /

original: mi rnams kyis dben pa ni mis dben par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mi rnams kyis dben pa ni mis dben par gyur pa ste /
translated: Solitude is a place devoid of people.

original: de'i phyir bsten par bya ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsten par bya ba'am /
translated: Therefore, it is to be resorted to,

original: 'gro ba 'dod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pas mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dod par bya ba ma yin par 'dod pas mi dge ba'o //
translated: Because it is not to be desired by those who desire to go, it is non-virtuous.

original: 'dod chags kyis gzir ba zhes bya ba ni gzir ba la 'chi bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis gzir ba zhes bya ba ni gzir ba la 'chi bar byed pa yin la /
translated: The phrase tormented by desire means that he is tormented by death.

original: 'chi bar byed pa 'am gzir pa ni 'dod chags yin pa de'i phyir 'dod chags kyi 'ching bas bcings pas 'dod chags dang 'ching bas bdag gzir bar gyur pa de bas na kho bo'i gnas skabs 'di 'dra ba 'am /
analyzed: 'chi bar byed pa 'am gzir pa ni 'dod chags yin pa de'i phyir 'dod chags kyi 'ching bas bcings pas 'dod chags dang 'ching bas bdag gzir bar gyur pa de bas na kho bo'i gnas skabs 'di 'dra ba 'am /
translated: Since death or torment is desire, he is tormented by desire and the fetter of desire, because he is bound by the fetter of desire. Therefore, he says, My condition is like this.

original: gzhung gzhan las ni 'dod chags kyi 'ching ba zhes 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhung gzhan las ni 'dod chags kyi 'ching ba zhes 'byung ba ste /
translated: In another text, it says the fetter of desire.

original: 'dir don de ni yul gyis dbang po kun nas bskyod pa'i mtshan nyid 'chi ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dir don de ni yul gyis dbang po kun nas bskyod pa'i mtshan nyid 'chi ba yin la /
translated: Here, the meaning is that death is the characteristic of the complete agitation of the sense faculty by the object.

original: de nyid 'dod chags yin te /
analyzed: de nyid 'dod chags yin te /
translated: That is desire itself,

original: na tshod la sogs pa 'joms pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na tshod la sogs pa 'joms pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of the destruction of youth and so on.

original: bsags pa ni snga na med pa bdag gir byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsags pa ni snga na med pa bdag gir byas pa'o //
translated: Accumulated means that which was not previously possessed.

original: mang du thob pa ni rab tu mang ba dang / rab tu rgya che ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mang du thob pa ni rab tu mang ba dang / rab tu rgya che ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Obtained in abundance means that which is very much obtained and very extensive.

original: mang du thob pa de yang 'ga' zhig tu gyur pa de dgag pa'i phyir smra ba bkag pa med pa rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: mang du thob pa de yang 'ga' zhig tu gyur pa de dgag pa'i phyir smra ba bkag pa med pa rnyed pa ste /
translated: And that much attainment is also for some, in order to stop that, the attainment of the absence of speech-stopping.

original: sdug bsngal med pas rnyed pa yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pas rnyed pa yin te /
translated: It is attainment without suffering,

original: rtag tu bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa dang bde bas so //
analyzed: rtag tu bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa dang bde bas so //
translated: because of always being one's own wish and happiness.

original: shin tu mngon par dga' ba ni rab tu dga' ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: shin tu mngon par dga' ba ni rab tu dga' ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: It is very delightful, by the method of delight.

original: dbang po tshim par gyur pa ni dbang po rgyas pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po tshim par gyur pa ni dbang po rgyas pa'o //
translated: It is the satisfaction of the faculties, the expansion of the faculties.

original: tshul khrims kyi gzi dang yang dag par ldan pa nyid kyi phyir bzhin gyi mdog gsal ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gzi dang yang dag par ldan pa nyid kyi phyir bzhin gyi mdog gsal ba'o //
translated: It is the clear face, because of being endowed with the splendor of morality.

original: pags pa'i skyon thig le nag po dang / gnyer ma la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir pags pa'i mdog yongs su dangs pa'o //
analyzed: pags pa'i skyon thig le nag po dang / gnyer ma la sogs pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir pags pa'i mdog yongs su dangs pa'o //
translated: It is the clear skin, because of being free from the faults of skin, such as black spots and wrinkles.

original: 'bad pa nyung ba ni bya ba nyung ba'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa nyung ba ni bya ba nyung ba'o //
translated: It is little effort, little activity.

original: gzhan la rag lus pas 'tsho ba'i thabs ni gzhan la rag lus pa ste de med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rag lus pas 'tsho ba'i thabs ni gzhan la rag lus pa ste de med pa'o //
translated: It is without dependence on others, without the means of livelihood dependent on others.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba ni ji srid 'tsho'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: For as long as one lives means until the end of one‚Äôs life.

original: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: Brahma is nirvana.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa ni spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa ni spyod pa yin te /
translated: The cause of that is the morality of the vow of individual liberation, etc., which is the practice.

original: tshangs par spyod pa dang 'gro bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde @38a * //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa dang 'gro bar byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de @38a * //
translated: Because it is the practice of brahma and the cause of going to brahma.

original: spyod par nus pa ni bsgrub par nus pa'o //
analyzed: spyod par nus pa ni bsgrub par nus pa'o //
translated: The ability to practice is the ability to accomplish.

original: tshangs par spyod pa khyad par ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa khyad par ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of excellence of brahma practice is there?

original: smras pa / ral pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / ral pa med pa nyid kyi phyir yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is said: It is complete because it is not torn.

original: 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / nyes pa ma lus pa yongs su spong bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bsgrub pa'i phyir dang / nyes pa ma lus pa yongs su spong bar byed pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure because it is the cause for accomplishing the result and for completely abandoning all faults.

original: yon tan sgrub par byed pa'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su byang ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan sgrub par byed pa'i thabs nyid yin pa'i phyir yongs su byang ba'o //
translated: It is purified because it is the very means for accomplishing good qualities.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni thar pa thob par bya ba'i phyir phyogs gzhan la rag lus pa med pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni thar pa thob par bya ba'i phyir phyogs gzhan la rag lus pa med pa'i phyir 'ba' zhig go //
translated: The word alone means that it is alone because it does not depend on other factors in order to attain liberation.

original: don gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni gang la gnas na rgyal po'i nor skye bar byed pa de ni don gyi gnas so //
analyzed: don gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni gang la gnas na rgyal po'i nor skye bar byed pa de ni don gyi gnas so //
translated: The word basis means that which is the basis for the arising of the king's wealth.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyu ni bag la nyal ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyu ni bag la nyal ma spangs pa'o //
translated: The cause of desire is the non-abandonment of latent tendencies.

original: gzhi ni yul lo //
analyzed: gzhi ni yul lo //
translated: The basis is the object.

original: dbang ni rten la bya'o //
analyzed: dbang ni rten la bya'o //
translated: Power should be understood in terms of the support.

original: rnam par rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu khro ba skyes nas smra ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu khro ba skyes nas smra ba'o //
translated: The word dispute means that when anger arises in a person, he speaks.

original: log par bzung nas ni sems rab tu 'khrugs pa'o //üîΩrtsod pa 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs su smra ba ni rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: log par bzung nas ni sems rab tu 'khrugs pa'o // rtsod pa 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni sna tshogs su smra ba ni rtsod pa ste /
translated: When he grasps wrongly, his mind becomes agitated.üîΩThe word arises means that various disputes arise.

original: smra ba dang phyir smra ba yin la /
analyzed: smra ba dang phyir smra ba yin la /
translated: It is a dispute because it is a discussion and counter-discussion.

original: de 'byung ba ni thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de 'byung ba ni thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: Its arising is its occurrence.

original: nyes pa ni bsngags pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa ni bsngags pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The word fault means dispraise.

original: 'ga' zhig kho na gnas te skabs su'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kho na gnas te skabs su'o //
translated: It is said that it occurs in some places.

original: kun tu sbyor bar byed ces bya ba ni dge slong dag rtsod par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor bar byed ces bya ba ni dge slong dag rtsod par gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will be bound‚Äù means that the monks will be in dispute.

original: bslab pa btang ste zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dngos po las nyams pa rjes su thob pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa btang ste zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dngos po las nyams pa rjes su thob pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will give up their training‚Äù means that they will fall from their status as monks.

original: 'phya zhing smod pa ni 'phya zhing smod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phya zhing smod pa ni 'phya zhing smod par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will be despised and criticized‚Äù means that they will be despised and criticized.

original: ngan pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEvil‚Äù means that they will be devoid of good qualities.

original: grong mi zhes bya ba ni mi bshes pa'i sgo nas smad pa'o //
analyzed: grong mi zhes bya ba ni mi bshes pa'i sgo nas smad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will be called townsmen‚Äù means that they will be despised because they are not spiritual practitioners.

original: dpal med pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi dpal las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpal med pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam gyi dpal las yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will be without glory‚Äù means that they will fall from the glory of the noble path.

original: gsad par bya ba ni srog dang bral bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsad par bya ba ni srog dang bral bar bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will be killed‚Äù means that they will be deprived of life.

original: rgya che ba ni 'jig rten thams cad la rab tu grags pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni 'jig rten thams cad la rab tu grags pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will be famous‚Äù means that they will be well known in all the world.

original: rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po ni rgyal rigs kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal rigs shing s'a la chen po ni rgyal rigs kyi mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe great sal trees of the warrior class‚Äù means the best of the warrior class.

original: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs shing s'a la chen po ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe great sal trees of the brahmin class‚Äù means the best of the brahmin class.

original: mchog tu gyur pa dag mi 'ong zhing mi sdod do //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa dag mi 'ong zhing mi sdod do //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will not come and they will not stay.‚Äù

original: gus pa med pa ni bla ma'i yul la gus pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gus pa med pa ni bla ma'i yul la gus pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Lack of respect is the absence of respect for the guru.

original: bsti stang med pa zhes bya ba ni bla ma'i yul la gtso bo'i blo dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: bsti stang med pa zhes bya ba ni bla ma'i yul la gtso bo'i blo dang bral ba'o //
translated: Lack of reverence is the absence of the attitude of esteeming the guru.

original: smra ba ni brjod pa yin la sems pa ni shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba ni brjod pa yin la sems pa ni shes par byed pa'o //
translated: Speech is expression; thought is understanding.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo 'khor brgya phrag mang po gang yin pa de ni 'dir brgya phrag @38b du ma ste de'i 'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo 'khor brgya phrag mang po gang yin pa de ni 'dir brgya phrag @38b du ma ste de'i 'o //
translated: The many hundreds of thousands of disciples are here called many hundreds of thousands.

original: snyan pa dang gya nom pa dag las shin tu snyan pa ni snyan la 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: snyan pa dang gya nom pa dag las shin tu snyan pa ni snyan la 'jam pa'o //
translated: Of the pleasant and the sublime, the very pleasant is pleasant and gentle.

original: sbrang bus rnam par sgyur ba ni sbrang rtsi ste /
analyzed: sbrang bus rnam par sgyur ba ni sbrang rtsi ste /
translated: The transformation of the bee is honey.

original: tshigs ma med pa des kha tshim par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshigs ma med pa des kha tshim par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the satisfaction produced by that which is without chaff.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po 'di la mnga' ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul chen po'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po 'di la mnga' ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul chen po'o //
translated: He is of great power because he has mastery over great miracles.

original: shin tu ngo mtshar che bar nye bar ston par spyod pas na mthu che ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu ngo mtshar che bar nye bar ston par spyod pas na mthu che ba'o //
translated: He is of great might because he practices the teaching of the most wondrous things.

original: ting nge 'dzin khyad par can rnyed pas na stobs che ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin khyad par can rnyed pas na stobs che ba'o //
translated: He is of great strength because he has attained special meditative stabilization.

original: chad pas ma yin zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang ngag gi chad pa spangs pas so //
analyzed: chad pas ma yin zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang ngag gi chad pa spangs pas so //
translated: Not by punishment means not by material or verbal punishment.

original: mtshon chas ma yin zhes bya ba ni mtshon chas tshar gcad pa spangs pas so //
analyzed: mtshon chas ma yin zhes bya ba ni mtshon chas tshar gcad pa spangs pas so //
translated: Not by weapons means not by physical punishment.

original: chos kyis zhes bya ba ni rigs pas so //üîΩsnyoms pas zhes bya ba ni 'dul bar byed pa'i ngan pa spangs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: chos kyis zhes bya ba ni rigs pas so // snyoms pas zhes bya ba ni 'dul bar byed pa'i ngan pa spangs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: By the Dharma means by what is reasonable.

original: yang na gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: yang na gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: By reconciliation means either because of abandoning bad behavior or else because of protecting the minds of others.

original: nor gyi dbang du byas pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas gtso bor byed pa ste /
analyzed: nor gyi dbang du byas pa zhes bya ba ni rdzas gtso bor byed pa ste /
translated: By the power of wealth means by making material things primary.

original: ji srid lo 'am /
analyzed: ji srid lo 'am /
translated: For as long as a year,üîΩor for as long as ten months,

original: ji srid zla ba bcu'i bar du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid zla ba bcu'i bar du tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya'o //
translated: one should practice celibacy.

original: zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyis tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa'i phyir de nor gyi dbang du byas pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bu'i rang bzhin gyi sems kyis tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa'i phyir de nor gyi dbang du byas pa'am /
translated: Because of practicing celibacy with a mind of that nature, it is called ‚Äúby the power of wealth.‚Äù

original: mtho ris kyi bde ba'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa gang yin pa de dag nor gyi dbang du byas nas tshangs par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mtho ris kyi bde ba'i phyir tshangs par spyod pa spyad pa gang yin pa de dag nor gyi dbang du byas nas tshangs par spyod pa'o //
translated: The celibate life lived for the sake of the happiness of the higher realms is celibacy based on wealth.

original: de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúits aspects, etc.‚Äù is explained:

original: rnam pa ni rab tu byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba ste /
analyzed: rnam pa ni rab tu byung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i bya ba ste /
translated: Its aspects are the activities that are in conformity with going forth.

original: kun tu spyod par grags pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu spyod par grags pa'o //
translated: They are well known as the conduct.

original: rtags ni rab tu byung ba'i cha lugs so //
analyzed: rtags ni rab tu byung ba'i cha lugs so //
translated: Its signs are the outward appearance of one who has gone forth.

original: mtshan ma ni nyes par spyod pa las zlog pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni nyes par spyod pa las zlog pa'o //
translated: Its marks are the avoidance of misdeeds.

original: bsnyen pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i rjes su zhugs pa'o //üîΩldan par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de dag dang shin tu 'byor par gyur pa 'am /
analyzed: bsnyen pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga'i rjes su zhugs pa'o // ldan par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de dag dang shin tu 'byor par gyur pa 'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe pursuit of‚Äù refers to the pursuit of the five sense pleasures.

original: de dag la shin tu chags par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la shin tu chags par gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving become endowed with‚Äù means having become endowed with them or having become attached to them.

original: srog gi mtha' ni srog gi ma thar gtugs pa'o //
analyzed: srog gi mtha' ni srog gi ma thar gtugs pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe end of life‚Äù means the end of life.

original: zhal ta ba drang srong byin dang / snying pa zhes bya ba la khyim mam rgyal po'i pho brang na mchog tu yid brtan par bya ba gang yin pa de ni zhal ta ba zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: zhal ta ba drang srong byin dang / snying pa zhes bya ba la khyim mam rgyal po'i pho brang na mchog tu yid brtan par bya ba gang yin pa de ni zhal ta ba zhes bya'o ;
translated: The one who is most trusted in a house or a king's palace is called an attendant.

original: /'di gnyis 'tsho ba dang longs spyod kyang tshol ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: /'di gnyis 'tsho ba dang longs spyod kyang tshol ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: These two are called those who seek livelihood and enjoyments.

original: tshol ba ni yongs su tshol ba yin te /
analyzed: tshol ba ni yongs su tshol ba yin te /
translated: Seeking means thoroughly seeking.

original: 'di gnyis kyi srog 'jig pa'i rgyu las yongs su bsrung bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi srog 'jig pa'i rgyu las yongs su bsrung bar bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they should be thoroughly protected from the causes of destroying their lives.

original: skra dkar skyes pa ni rgas pa'o //
analyzed: skra dkar skyes pa ni rgas pa'o //
translated: The arising of white hair is old age.

original: rgas pas rid pa ni 'khogs pa'o /üîΩrgas @39a * //
analyzed: rgas pas rid pa ni 'khogs pa'o / rgas @39a * //
translated: Old age and emaciation is decrepitude.

original: pas yan lag gi tshigs shin tu lhod par gyur pa ni dgog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: pas yan lag gi tshigs shin tu lhod par gyur pa ni dgog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Old age and the extreme looseness of the joints of the limbs is bentness.

original: zung shig ces bya ba klag pa dang / bcang ba zhes bya ba ni mi brjed pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: zung shig ces bya ba klag pa dang / bcang ba zhes bya ba ni mi brjed pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The reading grasp and retain is from the perspective of non-forgetting.

original: gzhan 'dzin du bcug pa yang don gyi sgo dang / klog tu bcug pa yang yi ge'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: gzhan 'dzin du bcug pa yang don gyi sgo dang / klog tu bcug pa yang yi ge'i sgo nas so //
translated: Engaging others to uphold is from the perspective of the meaning, and engaging others to read is from the perspective of the letters.

original: don dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase endowed with meaning

original: don dang 'byor pa dang chos dang yang 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: don dang 'byor pa dang chos dang yang 'byor pa'o //
translated: means endowed with wealth and endowed with the Dharma.üîΩIt is endowed with pure conduct

original: tshangs par spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is in accord with pure conduct.

original: tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o //üîΩmngon par shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa dang ldan pa'o // mngon par shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is endowed with superknowledge

original: zag pa med pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ye shes bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates uncontaminated knowledge.

original: yang dag par byang chub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang dag par byang chub pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is endowed with perfect enlightenment

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro // mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because it is the nirvana with remainder.üîΩThe phrase endowed with nirvana

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means it is the nirvana without remainder.

original: snying rje skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir snying rje'i rgyu can gyi yi ge'i rnam pa des 'du ba dang song ba ni rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: snying rje skye ba'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir snying rje'i rgyu can gyi yi ge'i rnam pa des 'du ba dang song ba ni rgyu ba'o //
translated: The phrase endowed with the cause of compassion means that it is the cause of compassion because it is the sign of the arising of compassion. The term endowed with the cause of compassion refers to the syllables that are the cause of compassion. Endowed with coming and going means that it moves.

original: rgyal po'i rigs las skyes pa'i phyir rgyal rigs so //
analyzed: rgyal po'i rigs las skyes pa'i phyir rgyal rigs so //
translated: The term royal class means that it is born in the royal class.

original: rgyal phran gyis spyi bos phyag byas pa nyid kyi phyir spyi bor dbang bskur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal phran gyis spyi bos phyag byas pa nyid kyi phyir spyi bor dbang bskur ba'o //
translated: because he was worshipped by the heads of the vassal kings, he is the one who is consecrated on the head.

original: de las khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni grong khyer mdzes par byas pa bas lam shin tu khyad par du 'phags par mdzes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de las khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni grong khyer mdzes par byas pa bas lam shin tu khyad par du 'phags par mdzes par byas pa'o //
translated: The one who is more distinguished than that means that he is more distinguished than the one who beautifies the city, like the one who beautifies the road.

original: phyir bcos mi nus pa ni ma zhu ba ste yan lag 'khums pa'o //
analyzed: phyir bcos mi nus pa ni ma zhu ba ste yan lag 'khums pa'o //
translated: The one who cannot be cured means the one who cannot be cured, like the one with a paralyzed limb.

original: 'khor los rnam par bcom pas 'khor los brkos pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: 'khor los rnam par bcom pas 'khor los brkos pa'i sa'o //
translated: The one who is carved by the wheel means the one whose land is carved by the wheel.

original: ngo ni shi ba'i lus so //
analyzed: ngo ni shi ba'i lus so //
translated: The one who is a corpse means the one who is dead.

original: shin tu rnam par 'gyur ba ni gzigs mi sdug par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par 'gyur ba ni gzigs mi sdug par gyur pa'o //
translated: The one who is extremely changed means the one who has become ugly.

original: nus pa ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nus pa ni nang gi spro ba'o //
analyzed: nus pa ji lta ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nus pa ni nang gi spro ba'o //
translated: The one who has the ability, etc. means the one who has the ability, which is inner enthusiasm.

original: stobs ni phan par byed pa phun sum tshogs pas so //
analyzed: stobs ni phan par byed pa phun sum tshogs pas so //
translated: The one who has strength means the one who has the perfection of benefit.

original: ngan pa ni rigs dma' mor skyes pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pa ni rigs dma' mor skyes pa'o //
translated: The one who is low means the one who is born in a low caste.
